results.title: Britain's sporting heritage
results.brief_description: A montage of favourite sporting events in Britain. Athletics, tennis, skating, golf and cycling; team games including soccer and rugby, cricket and hockey. Famous sporting personalities and some young champions of the future in action.

results.title: Britain's new resources
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
A brief study of the uses to which Britain is putting her limited natural resources; the harvesting, scientific drying, and storing of short grass for feeding cattle all the year round; the planting of forests and cutting of timber; harnessing of hydro-electric power; soap manufacture without fats; the use of seaweed in the manufacture of many products; production of magnesium from the waters of the North Sea.

results.title: Bristol: British city
results.creator_credit: Mary Francis, Alexander Shaw and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: The people of Bristol tell of their city, long since called the Maritime Capital of the West of England; a city with whose history many pioneers, adventurers and navigators, and many great moral and spiritual leaders have been associated. With its bustling life and half a million citizens, the city’s efficiency is still symbolised by the old phrase “shipshape and Bristol fashion”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mary Francis, Alexander Shaw and World Wide Pictures

results.title: Bristol fashion
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Terry Ashwood and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: The history and development of the Port of Bristol - the only major municipally owned port in Britain. Illustrates the facilities available in the city docks and at Avonmouth and Portishead, and discusses plans for the expansion of dock services. Sequences on the history of architecture of Bristol are interwoven.

results.title: Brisbane: city in the sun
results.creator_credit: Hugh McInnes, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the pattern of life in Brisbane, Queensland. Aspects such as commerce, tourist appeal and the social pastimes of locals and tourists are depicted. Includes views of the races, the beach and Brisbane River. Camera: Edward Cranstone Sound: Donald Kennedy Music: Don Andrews

results.title: Brisbane 1982: the twelfth Commonwealth Games
results.creator_credit: Terence McMahon Productions and Terence McMahon
results.brief_description: Produced as part of Comalco’s sponsorship of the Commonwealth Games to be held in Brisbane in 1982. Includes historic newsreel footage of major performances by Australians in the past Commonwealth Games. Also shows some of Australia’s athletes training for the 1982 Games.
